TEXT: CARDINAL . Mr PERSON lives at GPE ( in the province of GPE ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE he sued Mr PERSON , Mr E.Q.Y. and PERSON in the GPE magistrate ’s court ( pretore ) . He sought to have them ordered to move the low wall which enclosed their properties so that the width of the adjoining road should be not QUANTITY along the whole of its length .

CARDINAL . The case was listed on DATE . At the first hearing , on DATE , the applicant and Mr E.Q.Y. asked for an adjournment so that the other parties’ pleadings could be studied . The magistrate adjourned the proceedings to CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE Mr Goisis’ lawyer applied for an earlier date . The magistrate refused the application on DATE , on the grounds that there was no urgency and that the time allowed was in accordance with the usual practice .

On DATE , however , he agreed to bring the hearing forward to CARDINAL DATE , on account of a change in the timetable . When DATE came , ORG raised an objection to jurisdiction - joining Mr PERSON and PERSON , who had already made such an objection in their pleadings of CARDINAL DATE - and sought a second adjournment .

CARDINAL . On DATE , on an application by Mr E.Q.Y. , the magistrate ordered the joinder of a limited company , ORG . He adjourned the proceedings to CARDINAL May and then , of his own motion on this occasion , to CARDINAL DATE . Other hearings were held on DATE and DATE and CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . On the last - mentioned date the magistrate reserved judgment , but on DATE he relisted the case and commissioned an expert opinion .
CARDINAL . The proceedings were reopened on DATE , when a deadline of DATE was set for the filing of the expert ’s report , and the proceedings continued on DATE and DATE and DATE .

CARDINAL . In a judgment of DATE , which was filed at the registry on DATE , the magistrate declined jurisdiction in favour of ORG . He also set a strict deadline of DATE for resuming the proceedings , and these were resumed on CARDINAL DATE .
